org.vngx.jsch

Class ChannelSftp

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.Channel
      • org.vngx.jsch.ChannelSftp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public final class ChannelSftp
extends Channel
    Implementation of ChannelSession for opening a SFTP channel which runs as a subsystem for "sftp". This protocol provides secure file transfer (and more generally file system access). It is designed so that it could be used to implement a secure remote file system service as well as a secure file transfer service. In general, this protocol follows a simple request-response model. Each request and response contains a sequence number and multiple requests may be pending simultaneously. There are a relatively large number of different request messages, but a small number of possible response messages. Each request has one or more response messages that may be returned in result (e.g., a read either returns data or reports error status). The SSH File Transfer Protocol has changed over time, before it's standardization. The following is a description of the incompatible changes between different versions. 10.1 Changes between versions 3 and 2 - The SSH_FXP_READLINK and SSH_FXP_SYMLINK messages were added. - The SSH_FXP_EXTENDED and SSH_FXP_EXTENDED_REPLY messages were added. - The SSH_FXP_STATUS message was changed to include fields `error message' and `language tag'. 10.2 Changes between versions 2 and 1 - The SSH_FXP_RENAME message was added. 10.3 Changes between versions 1 and 0 - Implementation changes, no actual protocol changes. TODO For performance, since SFTP channel is not thread-safe/synchronized, instance variables should be used to cache state to reduce the amount of redundant traffic and object creation; for instance, a single header instance could be reused across a the entire SFTP session.

    Note: This class is not thread-safe and should be externally synchronized.

    Author:
    Atsuhiko Yamanaka, Michael Laudati

      class  ChannelSftp.LsEntry
      Represents an entry returned by the 'ls' SFTP command containing information about a file or folder on the remote system.

        public void start()
           throws JSchException
        Description copied from class: Channel
        Starts the channel after connection through the session. Implementations can override this method to define specific behavior. TODO Should this method be publicly exposed? It's always called after a successful connection... should external code ever need to call it?

      • setFilenameEncoding

        public void setFilenameEncoding(String encoding)
                         throws SftpException
        Sets the file name encoding to use. By default, filename encoding is UTF-8. If the SFTP server version does not support changing the filename encoding than a SftpException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        encoding - to use for path/file names
        Throws:
        SftpException - if not connected or server doesn't support different encodings

        Parameters:
        path - to check
        Returns:
        absolute path from server
        Throws:
        SftpException - if any errors occur

      • setAgentForwarding

        public void setAgentForwarding(boolean agentForwarding)
        Sets if agent forwarding should be requested after connecting. This value must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect.
        Parameters:
        agentForwarding - true if agent forwarding should be requested

      • setX11Forwarding

        public void setX11Forwarding(boolean x11Forwarding)
        Sets if X11 forwarding should be requested after connecting. This value must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect.
        Parameters:
        x11Forwarding - true if X11 forwarding should be requested
        See Also:
        6.3.1. Requesting X11 Forwarding

      • setEnv

        public void setEnv(String name,
                   String value)
        Sets the environment variable to request after connecting. These values must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect. If name and value need to be passed to the remote in your favorite encoding, use setEnv(byte[], byte[]).
        Parameters:
        name - for environment variable
        value - for environment variable
        See Also:
        6.4 Environment Variable Passing

      • setEnv

        public void setEnv(byte[] name,
                   byte[] value)
        Sets the environment variable to request after connecting. These values must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect.
        Parameters:
        name - of environment variable
        value - of environment variable
        See Also:
        6.4 Environment Variable Passing

      • setPty

        public void setPty(boolean pty)
        Sets if a Pseudo-Terminal should be requested after connecting. This value must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect.
        Parameters:
        pty - true if pseudo terminal should be requested
        See Also:
        6.2. Requesting a Pseudo-Terminal

      • setTerminalMode

        public void setTerminalMode(byte[] terminalMode)
        Sets the terminal mode to request.
        Parameters:
        terminalMode -

      • setPtySize

        public void setPtySize(int col,
                       int row,
                       int wp,
                       int hp)
        Sets the pseudo terminal's window dimension. If the channel is connected and a pseudo terminal has been requested, then dynamically makes a request to update the terminal window as specified.
        Parameters:
        col - terminal width, columns
        row - terminal height, rows
        wp - terminal width, pixels
        hp - terminal height, pixels
        See Also:
        6.7. Window Dimension Change Message

      • setPtyType

        public void setPtyType(String terminalType)
        Sets the terminal type to request. This value must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect.
        Parameters:
        terminalType - (for example, "vt100")

      • setPtyType

        public void setPtyType(String terminalType,
                       int col,
                       int row,
                       int wp,
                       int hp)
        Sets the terminal type and window size to request. These values must be set prior to connecting the channel to have any effect.
        Parameters:
        terminalType - (for example, "vt100")
        col - terminal width, columns
        row - terminal height, rows
        wp - terminal width, pixels
        hp - terminal height, pixels
